Class BusinessGrid

  • BBjWidget
    • AbstractBCBoundWidget
      • BusinessGrid

  • public class BusinessGrid
extends AbstractBCBoundWidget
implements IPersistentState

    BBj Business Grid
    Uses a Business Component (BC), BCBinder and BBjGridExWidget.

    See Also:
    []

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BusinessGrid(BBjChildWindow wnd!)

      The constructor using an existing child-window (canvas) on which the widget is created.

      BusinessGrid(BBjWindow wnd!, BBjInt id!, BBjInt x!, BBjInt y!, BBjInt w!, BBjInt h!)

      The constructor that creates the child-window (canvas) on which the widget is created.

      voidsetConfigurationWidgetUser(String user!)
      voidsetRealm(String realm!)
      voidsetStateChangeCallback(String methodName!, CustomObject callable!)

      The widget will call this method to register itself for state changes of the component.
      The method should set a callback that calls the method 'methodName' on 'callable!', whenever the state changes.
      Event should be a BBjCustomEvent.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BusinessGrid

        public BusinessGrid(BBjChildWindow wnd!)

        The constructor using an existing child-window (canvas) on which the widget is created.

      • BusinessGrid

        public BusinessGrid(BBjWindow wnd!, BBjInt id!, BBjInt x!, BBjInt y!, BBjInt w!, BBjInt h!)

        The constructor that creates the child-window (canvas) on which the widget is created.

        Parameters:
        BBjWindow wnd!: parent window
        BBjInt id: the control ID
        BBjInt x: x-location
        BBjInt y: y-location
        BBjInt w: width
        BBjInt h: height

        public void redraw(Boolean f_init!)

        This method is called whenever the widget needs to be rendered.

        Parameters:
        Boolean f_init!: if TRUE, the control is rendered for the first time, so this method performs initial rendering

      • retrieveState

        public String retrieveState()

        This method will provide the widget with the current state of the component.
        The widget will store this data for later retrieval.

        Returns:
        String containing the current state of all columns

      • setStateChangeCallback

        public void setStateChangeCallback(String methodName!, CustomObject callable!)

        The widget will call this method to register itself for state changes of the component.
        The method should set a callback that calls the method 'methodName' on 'callable!', whenever the state changes.
        Event should be a BBjCustomEvent.

        Parameters:
        methodName!
        callable!
